feed.title: GitHub Perl Weekly Trending
feed.subtitle: Weekly Trending of Perl in GitHub

entry.title: regru/API-CPanel
entry.summary:
API-CPanel

The README is used to introduce the module and provide instructions on how to install the module, any machine dependencies it may have (for example C compilers and installed libraries) and any other information that should be provided before the module is installed.

A README file is required for CPAN modules since CPAN extracts the README file from a module distribution so that people browsing the archive can use it get an idea of the modules uses. It is usually a good idea to provide version information here so that people can decide whether fixes for the module are worth downloading.

INSTALLATION

To install this module type the following:

perl Makefile.PL make make test make install

DEPENDENCIES

This module requires these other modules and libraries:

COPYRIGHT AND LICENCE

Put the correct copyright and licence information here.

Copyright (C) 2010 by Vlasov Konstantin

This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the same terms as Perl itself, either Perl version 5.10.1 or, at your option, any later version of Perl 5 you may have available.

entry.title: mbainter/momentum-tools
entry.summary:
Tools, Scripts and other Miscellaneous items useful for managing Momentum Environments

This repository contains various (usually simple) scripts, regular expressions, nagios plugins, etc that may be useful for managing/monitoring a Message Systems Momentum cluster. This is provided as is, without warranty of any kind, or any sort of promise of support by Message Systems.

All content in this repository is provided under the current BSD license. If it works, great, if it breaks you get to keep all the pieces.

If you have suggestions for improvements or things to add, clone the repo, add them, and send me a pull request, with the understanding that it also must be made available under the BSD license, or I will not accept it.

entry.title: skelz0r/balembot
entry.summary:
BALEMBOY FTW!

OH MY BOT!

Launch

Create password.txt with this syntax:

nickname
password

nickname is nickname, and password is password (U DON'T SAY!)

Contribute

  • SPOON IT!
  • POULE REQUEST IT!
  • OKi?
